Sentencas: A novel hybrid system coupling solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with thermoradiative (TR) and photovoltaic (PV) cells is proposed, evaluated, and optimized for energy cascade utilization.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization

Sentencas: Theories of electrochemistry, Planck radiative heat transfer, and first law of thermodynamics are applied to assess and optimize the performance of the hybrid system.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization

Sentencas: Firstly, energy balance analysis is conducted to obtain suitable area ratio between the subsystems and the SOFC.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization

Sentencas: A homo-structure InAs-InAs is chosen as an example of the TP-PV cells.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization

Sentencas: The peak power density of 0.669 W cm-2 and the maximum efficiency of 0.770 and the relevant work conditions are achieved through parametric optimal analysis.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization

Sentencas: It is also found that decreasing the leakage resistance of the SOFC can enhance electricity production and efficiency of the hybrid system.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization

Sentencas: Secondly, a GaSb-InSb TP-PV cells are adopted to couple with the SOFC for performance enhancement.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization

Sentencas: Finally, the positive effects of back surface reflector and the negative effects of irreversible heat transfers on the hybrid system are discussed.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization

Sentencas: The obtained results are helpful for designing and optimizing the SOFC-TR-PV hybrid systems.
Titulo: A hybrid system integrating solid oxide fuel cell and thermo-radiative-photovoltaic cells for energy cascade utilization
